===Etymology===
{{unk.|lang=zh}}. Various hypotheses exist:
* Derived from {{och-l|亮|to shine}} with the nominalising *''k-'' prefix ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; ''[[apud]]'' Baxter, [[personal|p.]] [[communication|c.]]);
* Cognate with {{och-l|景|bright}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}});
* Re-etymologisation of the nearly identical earlier word {{och-l|監|tr=*kraːms}}, {{och-l|鑑|tr=*kraːms|mirror}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|鏡鞍|かがみぐら}}: a type of [[saddle]]
* {{ja-r|鏡映|きょうえい}}: a [[mirror image]], a mirrored [[projection]]
* {{ja-r|鏡王女|^かがみ の ^おおきみ}}: one of the poets of the [[w:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]
* {{ja-r|鏡架|きょうか}}: a mirror [[stand]]
* {{ja-r|鏡花|きょうか}}: "a [[flower]] in a mirror" → a metaphor for something that can be seen but not touched
* {{ja-r|鏡花水月|きょうか すいげつ}}: "a flower in a mirror, the moon in the water" → a metaphor for something that can be seen but not touched
* {{ja-r|鏡花水月法|きょうか すいげつほう}}: a style of [[expression]] or [[storytelling]] that does not directly describe things, and instead indirectly evokes the appearance of things
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かがみ|影|tr1=kaga|t1=shadow; outline; figure; image|pos1=ancient combining form of modern reading ''kage''|見|tr2=mi|t2=seeing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb {{m|ja|見る}} ''miru'', “to see, to look at”, cognate with {{m|ja|目}} ''me'', “eye”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かがみ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かがみ}}

# an instrument that reflects an image: a [[mirror]]
#* {{RQ:Man'yōshū|14|3468}}
#*: 夜麻杼里乃 乎呂能波都乎尓 '''可賀美'''可家 刀奈布倍美許曽 奈尓与曽利鶏米
#*:: やまとりの をろのはつをに '''かがみ'''かけ となふべみこそ なによそりけめ
#*:: ''yamatori no oro no hatsuo ni '''kagami''' kake tonau bemi koso na ni yosori kemu''
# {{lb|ja|sort=かがみ|Noh}} the panel at the back of a [[Noh]] stage that is painted with an image of an old pine tree
# the [[barrelhead]] or [[lid]] of a [[saké]] [[barrel]]
#: {{ja-usex|昨日、'''鏡'''を抜いた。|きのう、 '''かがみ''' を ぬいた。|They removed the '''barrelhead''' yesterday. → They opened the saké barrel yesterday.}}

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|鏡は女の魂|かがみ は おんな の たまし.い}}: "a mirror is a woman's soul"
* {{ja-r|鏡が曇ると魂が曇る|かがみ が くもる と たまし.い が くもる}}: "if the looking glass is cloudy, so too is one's soul" → (particularly regarding women) one's appearance is a reflection of one's psyche, and a disordered appearance indicates a disordered mind
* {{ja-r|鏡は重磨によって輝く|かがみ は じゅうま に よって かがやく}}: "a mirror shines from heavy polishing" → [[practice makes perfect]]
* {{ja-r|鏡は容貌を見せ酒は心を現す|かがみ は かたち を みせ、さけ は こころ を あらわす}}:"a mirror shows one's appearance; alcohol brings out one's true thoughts" → a metaphor for how drinking can lead to freer expression of what one really thinks
* {{ja-r|鏡に掛く|かがみ に かく}}: "show in a mirror" → extremely clear, extremely certain: [[as clear as day]]
* {{ja-r|鏡を掛く|かがみ を かく}}: "hang a mirror" → to know something in detail as if looking at it in a mirror: to [[know like the back of one's hand|know something like the back of one's hand]], to [[know something inside and out]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鏡いご|かがみ いご}}: a type of gelatin made from cooked-down seaweed, used as a side dish during [[Obon]] in certain regions
* {{ja-r|鏡ヶ池|^かがみ-ヶ-^いけ}}: "Mirror Pond", a place name: any of several ponds in Tokyo, Aichi, and elsewhere
* {{ja-r|鏡なす|かがみなす}}: to hold something [[dear]] and treat it with care (as one used to do when mirrors were rare and expensive); to be mirror-like (obsolete, and only applied to specific bodies of water)
* {{ja-r|鏡の家|かがみ の いえ}}: a [[box]] or [[case]] for a mirror
* {{ja-r|鏡の奩|かがみ の す}}: a [[box]] or [[case]] for a mirror
* {{ja-r|鏡の間|かがみ の ま}}: in [[Noh]], a [[room]] or [[alcove]] behind the [[curtain]] and affixed with a mirror for [[player]]s to check their [[appearance]]; a similar space in other [[theater]]s; a room with mirrors on all four walls, such as at [[Versailles]]
* {{ja-r|鏡板|かがみ いた}}: a [[panel]] that forms the back wall of a [[Noh]] [[stage]] and is traditionally [[painted]] with a [[picture]] of an old [[pine]] [[tree]]
* {{ja-r|鏡の松|かがみ の まつ}}: a [[painting]] of an old [[pine]] [[tree]] on the {{m|ja|鏡板|tr=kagami ita}} that forms the back wall of a [[Noh]] [[stage]]
* {{ja-r|鏡の御影|かがみ の みえい}}: {{qualifier|painting}} a [[depiction]] of a [[round]] [[window]] through which can be seen [[god]]s, [[spirit]]s, or [[Buddha]]s
{{der-bottom}}
